itemDescription: British politician, philanthropist and social reformer (1810-97)

wikipedia_page.main: James Heywood (28 May 1810 – 17 October 1897) was a British MP, philanthropist and social reformer.

response: Benjamin Heywood was born on 12 December 1793 in St Ann's Square, Manchester. He was the grandson of Thomas Percival, the son of Nathaniel Heywood and Ann Percival, the brother to Thomas Heywood and James Heywood, and the nephew to Samuel Heywood. He lived at "Claremont" to the north west of the city centre in Irlams o' th' Height.McConnell (2004) He graduated from the University of Glasgow.
